b. Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled

The primary activities at the South Charleston facility are the production of Polyols which are used in the manufacture of polyurethanes.  The Polyols that are manufactured are either Flexible Polyols or Polymer Polyols.  The RMP chemicals used in the manufacture of Flex Polyols are propylene oxide and ethylene oxide. The RMP chemicals used in manufacture of Polymer Polyols are acrylonitrile and vinylidene chloride (RMP flammable chemical).  In summary the Bayer South Charleston facility has three (3) RMP listed toxic chemicals and one flammable chemical. All three RMP toxic chemicals were modeled using worst case release parameters as a screening exercise to determine the distance to toxic endpoint.   Acryl

onitrile has the worst toxic case scenario (distance to toxic endpoint) followed in order of potential off-site impact by ethylene oxide and propylene oxide.  The flammable chemical (vinylidene chloride) was also modeled using worst case release parameters to determine distance to 1 pound per square inch overpressure.


c.  Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The South Charleston Plant complies with all elements of the OSHA PSM Rule and the EPA RMP Rule.  There are safety procedures, standard operation emergency procedures, accident investigations, hot work and line opening permits, extensive training programs, on-site emergency response teams, vessel inspection programs, and experienced personnel both in the salaried and hourly workforce.  

d.   Five Year Accident History

There have been no releases in the past five years with off-site consequences.  Since the initial implementation of the RMP rule there have been no offsite impacts from release of RMP chemicals from the South Charleston manufacturing facility. 

e.  Facility Emergency Response Program

The South Charleston Emergency Response System consists of volunteer emergency response teams from Bayer and the host company that work rotating shifts and straight days.  The goal is to have 3 Â¿ 6 emergency squad members always available on shift and this group is supplemented by straight day people, call outs and the South Charleston Fire Department.  The Bayer and host site emergency squad people receive approximately 16 to 24 hours of on-site training annually with some disciplines receiving off-site training as well in specialized subjects, such as fire fighting, rescue, incident command and Hazmat.  In the case of a significant fire the South Charleston Fire department would likely be involved.  The plant also participates in local fire and industrial mutual aid systems through the Kanawha Putnam Emergency Planning Committee (KPEPC).

a.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Bayer MaterialScience LLC is committed to the principles of Responsible Care which emphasize operating in a safe and environmentally correct manner. Management systems are in place to assure all facilities are complying with these principles.  There are Corporate Engineering Standards and Health, Environment and Safety Guidelines which address every aspect of Risk Management from design of intrinsically safe processes, to the use of risk assessment, to incident tracking and program audits. Bayer MaterialScience LLC is a Bayer AG company, which is headquartered in Leverkusen, Germany. The US (country) headquarters for Bayer is located in Pittsburgh, PA.  Bayer MaterialScience LLC has its own company structure, policies and procedures which are consistent with those of the holding company, but are customized to meet local regulations and standards.  Bayer AG has established guidelines for Responsible Care in Environmental Protection and Safety, which include a Directive for Process and Plant Safety that all Bayer facilities world-wide are expected to follow.  It provides guidance for safe process design and operation.

In the US, Bayer MaterialScience LLC is an active member of the American Chemistry Council's Responsible Care Initiative.  Bayer has implemented all seven codes (Pollution Prevention, Distribution, Product Stewardship, Employee health & Safety, Security: and Community Awareness & Emergency Response) of management practice.  Bayer MaterialScience LLC has a Health, Safety, Environment and Quality Policy which states that it is the companyÂ¿s responsibility to protect the environment and the health and safety of its employees, customers and communities.  This is a primary responsibility, of equal importance to any other business objective.  This is supported in the Bayer Ma

terialScience LLC Visions, Values and Beliefs, which emphasize applying technical expertise to advance our business while assuring the safety and protection of our employees, customers, communities and the environment.

The Bayer MaterialScience LLC South Charleston facility has implemented all of the corporate Health Environment and Safety Policies and Guidelines through site policies and procedures.  These include site Safety and Health Procedures, Emergency Response Procedures, Process Safety Management Procedures, Hazard Communication Procedures and Risk Management Procedures as well as safety plans in the individual production unit operating procedures.

The procedures address all aspects of emergency response including:
